metadata.title: A Probabilistic Calculus of Actions
metadata.abstractText: We present a symbolic machinery that admits both probabilistic and causal information about a given domain and produces proba­ bilistic statements about the effect of actions and the impact of observations. The calculus admits two types of conditioning operators: ordinary Bayes conditioning, P(ylX = x) , which represents the observation X = x, and causal conditioning, P(yldo( X = x)), read the probability of Y = y conditioned on hold­ ing X constant (at x) by deliberate action.
